original_content:
message_id: 17c3dae478e02e47
subject   : Subject: THE REWARD FOR FOLLOWING GOD
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 1 Oct 2021 16:06:44 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Don’t envy evil people; don’t desire their company. For *

*they spend their days plotting violence, and their words *



*Today’s Reflection:*

*are always stirring up trouble. *(Pro.24:1, 2)

we should *never* envy evil people, even though some

may be extremely popular or excessively rich. No

matter how much they have, it will fade and vanish

like grass that withers and dies. Those who follow God

live differently from the wicked and, in the end, will

have treasures in heaven. What an unbeliever gets on

earth may last for a *lifetime*, BUT what you get from

following God lasts *forever. *

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father I look forward to the day that*

*I will be able to claim my treasure in heaven. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
We should never envy evil people, even though some
may be extremely popular or excessively rich. No
matter how much they have, it will fade and vanish
like grass that withers and dies. Those who follow God
live differently from the wicked and, in the end, will
have treasures in heaven. What an unbeliever gets on
earth may last for a lifetime, BUT what you get from
following God lasts forever.
original_verse_text: Don’t envy evil people; don’t desire their company. For  they spend their days plotting violence, and their words are always stirring up trouble.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father I look forward to the day that I will be able to claim my treasure in heaven. Amen.
reflection:
We should never envy evil people, even though some
may be extremely popular or excessively rich. No
matter how much they have, it will fade and vanish
like grass that withers and dies. Those who follow God
live differently from the wicked and, in the end, will
have treasures in heaven. What an unbeliever gets on
earth may last for a lifetime, BUT what you get from
following God lasts forever.
subject: The Reward for Following God
verse_text: Don’t envy evil people; don’t desire their company. For  they spend their days plotting violence, and their words are always stirring up trouble.

original_content:
message_id: 17c42cbd82165652
subject   : Subject: THE ADVANTAGE OF HAVING WISE COUNSEL
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 2 Oct 2021 15:57:08 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*A wise man is mightier than a strong man, and a man *

*of knowledge is more powerful than a strong man. So *

*don’t go to war without wise guidance; victory depends*

* on having many counselors. *(Pro. 24:5-6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

In any major decision we make, it is not a sign of weak-

ness to ask for advice. Instead, it is foolish not to ask

for it. Find good advisers before making any big decis-

ions. They can help you expand your alternatives and

evaluate your choices.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, I pray that I will always find wise counsel. *

*The reason being is I cannot keep up with today’s technology. *

*So I pray help me out. **Amen. *
original_reflection_text:
In any major decision we make, it is not a sign of weak-
ness to ask for advice. Instead, it is foolish not to ask
for it. Find good advisers before making any big decis-
ions.
They can help you expand your alternatives and evaluate your choices.
original_subject: THE ADVANTAGE OF HAVING WISE COUNSEL
original_verse_text: A wise man is mightier than a strong man, and a man  of knowledge is more powerful than a strong man. So  don’t go to war without wise guidance; victory depends on having many counselors.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I will always find wise counsel. The reason being is I cannot keep up with today’s technology. So I pray help me out. Amen.
reflection:
In any major decision we make, it is not a sign of weak-
ness to ask for advice. Instead, it is foolish not to ask
for it. Find good advisers before making any big decis-
ions.
They can help you expand your alternatives and evaluate your choices.
subject: The Advantage of Having Wise Counsel
verse_text: A wise man is mightier than a strong man, and a man  of knowledge is more powerful than a strong man. So  don’t go to war without wise guidance; victory depends on having many counselors.

original_content:
message_id: 17c47e96bd94f6fc
subject   : Subject: KEEP YOUR BEHAVIOR IN CHECK
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 3 Oct 2021 15:47:32 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*A person who plans evil will get a reputation as*

* a trouble maker the schemes of a fool are sinful; everyone *

*despises a mocker. *(Pro. 24:8, 9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Plotting to do evil can be as wrong as doing it because what

you think determines what you will do. Left uncheck, wrong

desires will lead us to sin. God wants pure hearts, free from sin,

and planning evil brings sinful thoughts into our mind. Should

I say, “Then I might as well go ahead and do it because I’ve

already planned it?” *No*. You have sinned in your attitude, but

you have not yet harmed other people. You need to stop in your

tracks and ask God to forgive you and put you on a different path.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always dwell **on pure thoughts. *

*Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
Plotting to do evil can be as wrong as doing it because what you think determines what you will do. Left uncheck, wrong desires will lead us to sin.
God wants pure hearts, free from sin, and planning evil brings sinful thoughts into our mind. Should I say, “Then I might as well go ahead and do it because I’ve already planned it?” No .
You have sinned in your attitude, but you have not yet harmed other people. You need to stop in your
tracks and ask God to forgive you and put you on a different path.
original_verse_text: A person who plans evil will get a reputation as a trouble maker the schemes of a fool are sinful; everyone  despises a mocker.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always dwell on pure thoughts. Amen.
reflection:
Plotting to do evil can be as wrong as doing it because what you think determines what you will do. Left uncheck, wrong desires will lead us to sin.
God wants pure hearts, free from sin, and planning evil brings sinful thoughts into our mind. Should I say, “Then I might as well go ahead and do it because I’ve already planned it?” No .
You have sinned in your attitude, but you have not yet harmed other people. You need to stop in your
tracks and ask God to forgive you and put you on a different path.
subject: Keep Your Behavior in Check
verse_text: A person who plans evil will get a reputation as a trouble maker the schemes of a fool are sinful; everyone  despises a mocker.

original_content:
message_id: 17c4dacd18f02796
subject   : Subject: GROWING THROUGH TRIALS
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 4 Oct 2021 18:39:04 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*If you fail under pressure, your strength is not*

*very great. *(Pro. 24:10)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Times of trouble can be useful. They can show

you who you really are—what kind of character

you have developed. In addition, they can help

you grow stronger. When Jeremiah questioned

God because of the trouble he faced, God asked

how he ever expected to face big challenges if

the little ones tired him out (Jer. 12:5). Don’t

complain about your problems. The trouble you

face today is training you to be strong for the

more difficult situations you will face in the

future.

*Pastor Sather*

*O Lord of all wisdom give me the strength to *

*face today’s problems so that I will be ready *

*for tomorrows. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
Times of trouble can be useful. They can show
you who you really are—what kind of character
you have developed. In addition, they can help
you grow stronger. When Jeremiah questioned
God because of the trouble he faced, God asked
how he ever expected to face big challenges if
the little ones tired him out (Jeremiah 12:5). Don’t
complain about your problems. The trouble you
face today is training you to be strong for the
more difficult situations you will face in the
future.
original_verse_text: If you fail under pressure, your strength is not very great.
prayer: O Lord of all wisdom give me the strength to face today’s problems so that I will be ready for tomorrows. Amen.
reflection:
Times of trouble can be useful. They can show
you who you really are—what kind of character
you have developed. In addition, they can help
you grow stronger. When Jeremiah questioned
God because of the trouble he faced, God asked
how he ever expected to face big challenges if
the little ones tired him out (Jeremiah 12:5). Don’t
complain about your problems. The trouble you
face today is training you to be strong for the
more difficult situations you will face in the
future.
subject: Growing Through Trials
verse_text: If you fail under pressure, your strength is not very great.

original_content:
message_id: 17c52550016694bf
subject   : Subject: JUDGE NOT LEST YE BE JUDGED
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 5 Oct 2021 16:21:15 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Do not rejoice when your enemies fall into trouble. *

*Don’t be happy when they stumble. For the Lord *

*will be displeased with you and will turn His anger *

*away* *from them *(Pro. 24:17, 18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

To gloat over other people’s misfortune is to make

yourself the avenger and to put yourself in the place

of God, who alone is the real judge of all the earth.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, please forgive me if I gloat *

*over some one’s misfortune, for I do know better but *

*it seems to be human nature to think they got what the deserved; I do know
that you are the one true judge. Amen. *
original_reflection_text: To gloat over other people’s misfortune is to make yourself the avenger and to put yourself in the place of God, who alone is the real judge of all the earth.
original_subject: JUDGE NOT LEST YE BE JUDGED
original_verse_text: Do not rejoice when your enemies fall into trouble. Don’t be happy when they stumble. For the Lord will be displeased with you and will turn His anger away from them.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, please forgive me if I gloat over some one’s misfortune, for I do know better but it seems to be human nature to think they got what the deserved; I do know that you are the one true judge. Amen.
reflection: To gloat over other people’s misfortune is to make yourself the avenger and to put yourself in the place of God, who alone is the real judge of all the earth.
subject: Judge Not Lest Ye be Judged
verse_text: Do not rejoice when your enemies fall into trouble. Don’t be happy when they stumble. For the Lord will be displeased with you and will turn His anger away from them.

original_content:
message_id: 17c577dcccf76922
subject   : Subject: BEING A BETTER LISTENER
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 6 Oct 2021 16:23:55 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Faithful messengers are as refreshing as *

*snow in **the heat of summer . they revive the *

*spirit of their employer. *(Pro 25: 13)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Often it is difficult to find people you can really

trust. A faithful employee (“messenger’) is pun-

ctual, responsible, honest, and hardworking. This

person is invaluable as he or she helps take some

of the pressure off his or her employer. Find out

what your employer needs from you to make his

or her job easier, and *then do it!*

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, often it is difficult to understand *

*exactly what an employer actually expects. *

*Help **me to listen carefully so that I might *

*get a better understanding of the other per-*

*sons expectation. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
Often it is difficult to find people you can really trust. A faithful employee (“messenger’)
is pun-
ctual, responsible, honest, and hardworking. This person is invaluable as he or she helps take some
of the pressure off his or her employer. Find out what your employer needs from you to make his
or her job easier, and then do it!

prayer: Dear Lord, often it is difficult to understand exactly what an employer actually expects. Help me to listen carefully so that I might get a better understanding of the other persons expectation. Amen.

Often it is difficult to find people you can really trust. A faithful employee (“messenger’)
is pun-
ctual, responsible, honest, and hardworking. This person is invaluable as he or she helps take some
of the pressure off his or her employer. Find out what your employer needs from you to make his
or her job easier, and then do it!
subject: Being a Better Listener
verse_text: Faithful messengers are as refreshing as  snow in the heat of summer . they revive the  spirit of their employer.

original_content:
message_id: 17c5caf3bf45e509
subject   : Subject: WHAT DO YOU DO AFTER YOU GET OFF YOR KNEES?
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 7 Oct 2021 16:36:00 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*The prayers of a person who ignores the law are*

*despised. *(Pro 28:9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God does not listen to our prayers if we intend to go

back to our sin as soon as we get off our knees.

When we forsake our sin and follow Him, however,

He willing listens—no matter how bad our sin has

been. What closes His ears is not the depth of our

sin *BUT our secret intention to do it again.*

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, as I seek your forgive-*

*ness, help me stay clear of repeating that same*

* sin again. **Amen. *
original_reflection_text:
God does not listen to our prayers if we intend to go
back to our sin as soon as we get off our knees.
When we forsake our sin and follow Him, however,
He willing listens—no matter how bad our sin has
been. What closes His ears is not the depth of our
sin BUT our secret intention to do it again.
original_subject: WHAT DO YOU DO AFTER YOU GET OFF YOR KNEES?
original_verse_text: The prayers of a person who ignores the law are despised.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, as I seek your forgiveness, help me stay clear of repeating that same sin again. Amen.
reflection:
God does not listen to our prayers if we intend to go
back to our sin as soon as we get off our knees.
When we forsake our sin and follow Him, however,
He willing listens—no matter how bad our sin has
been. What closes His ears is not the depth of our
sin BUT our secret intention to do it again.
subject: What Do You Do After You Get Off Your Knees?
verse_text: The prayers of a person who ignores the law are despised.

original_content:
message_id: 17c618762477ffaf
subject   : Subject: THE FUTILITY OF PRIDE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 8 Oct 2021 15:10:35 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’ Verse:*

*Rich people picture themselves as* *wise, but*

* their real poverty is evident to the* *poor. *

(Pro. 28 11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Rich people often think they are wonderful, depending on no one, they take
credit for all they do. But that’s a hollow self-esteem. Through dependence
upon God in their struggles, the poor may develop a richness of spirit

that no amount of wealth can provide. The rich man can lose

all his material wealth, while no one can take away a poor man’s character.
Don’t be jealous of the rich, money

may be all they will ever have.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that I don’t*

*have much when it comes to earthly wealth, BUT*
*I have a mansion waiting for me in heaven. Amen*
original_reflection_text: Rich people often think they are wonderful, depending on no one, they take credit for all they do. But that’s a hollow self-esteem. Through dependence upon God in their struggles, the poor may develop a richness of spirit that no amount of wealth can provide. The rich man can lose all his material wealth, while no one can take away a poor man’s character. Don’t be jealous of the rich, money may be all they will ever have.
original_verse_text: Rich people picture themselves as wise, but their real poverty is evident to the poor.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that I don’t have much when it comes to earthly wealth, BUT I have a mansion waiting for me in heaven. Amen
reflection: Rich people often think they are wonderful, depending on no one, they take credit for all they do. But that’s a hollow self-esteem. The rich man can lose all his material wealth, while no one can take away a poor man’s character. Don’t be jealous of the rich, money may be all they will ever have.
subject: The Futility of Pride
verse_text: Rich people picture themselves as wise, but their real poverty is evident to the poor.

original_content:
message_id: 17c6bdb2f3ca00cf
subject   : Subject: WHEN TO SEEK ADVICE--WHEN TO GO IT ALONE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 10 Oct 2021 15:18:19 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today**’s Verse:*

*Trusting oneself is foolish, but those who walk *

*in wisdom are safe. *(Pro. 28:26)



*Today’s Reflection:*

For many people the rugged individualist is a

hero. We admire the bold, self-directed men

and women who know what they want and

fight for it. They are self-directed, neither giv-

ing nor asking advice. What a contrast to God’s

Way. A person can’t know the future or predict

the consequences of his or her choices with cer-

tainty. And so the totally self-reliant person is

doomed to failure. The wise person depends on

God.

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would **always *

*pray for Godly wisdom before making decisions that *

*I know very little about. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
For many people the rugged individualist is a hero. We
admire the bold, self-directed men and women who know what
they want and fight for it. They are self-directed, neither
giving nor asking advice. What a contrast to God’s Way. A
person can’t know the future or predict the consequences of
his or her choices with certainty. And so the totally
self-reliant person is doomed to failure. The wise person
depends on God.
original_subject: WHEN TO SEEK ADVICE--WHEN TO GO IT ALONE
original_verse_text:
Trusting oneself is foolish, but those who walk in wisdom
are safe.
prayer:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would always pray for
Godly wisdom before making decisions that I know very little
about. Amen.
reflection:
For many people the rugged individualist is a hero. We
admire the bold, self-directed men and women who know what
they want and fight for it. They are self-directed, neither
giving nor asking advice. What a contrast to God’s Way. A

his or her choices with certainty. And so the totally
self-reliant person is doomed to failure. The wise person
depends on God.
subject: When to Seek Advice--When to Go It Alone
verse_text:
Trusting oneself is foolish, but those who walk in wisdom
are safe.

original_content:
message_id: 17c710ba8dda2567
subject   : Subject: BE ALERT TO THE NEEDS OF OTHERS
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 11 Oct 2021 15:29:22 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Who ever gives to the poor will lack nothing. *

*But a cures will come upon those who close *

*their eyes to poverty. *(Pro. 28:27)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God wants us to identify with the needy; not

ignore them. The second part of this proverb

could be restated positively.” Those who open

their eyes to the poor people will be blessed.”

If we help others when they are in trouble, they

will do whatever they can do to return the favor.

Paul promises that God will supply all our needs

(Phil. 4:19): HE usually does this through other

people. What can you do today to help God

supply someone’s needs?

*Pastor Sather*

*Forgive me Lord, when I neglect the needs of *

*those who have fallen on hard times. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
God wants us to identify with the needy; not
ignore them. The second part of this proverb
could be restated positively.” Those who open
their eyes to the poor people will be blessed.”
If we help others when they are in trouble, they
will do whatever they can do to return the favor.
Paul promises that God will supply all our needs (Philippians 4:19): HE usually does this through other people. What can you do today to help God
supply someone’s needs?
original_subject: BE ALERT TO THE NEEDS OF OTHERS
original_verse_text: Who ever gives to the poor will lack nothing.  But a cures will come upon those who close  their eyes to poverty.
prayer: Forgive me Lord, when I neglect the needs of those who have fallen on hard times. Amen.
reflection:
God wants us to identify with the needy; not
ignore them. The second part of this proverb
could be restated positively.” Those who open
their eyes to the poor people will be blessed.”
If we help others when they are in trouble, they
will do whatever they can do to return the favor.
Paul promises that God will supply all our needs (Philippians 4:19): HE usually does this through other people. What can you do today to help God
supply someone’s needs?

original_content:
message_id: 17c762b2bbf69c70
subject   : Subject: THE NEED TO CORRECT OUR CHILDREN
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 12 Oct 2021 15:21:53 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*To discipline and reprimand a child produces wisdom, but a mother is
disgraced by an undis-ciplined child. *(Pro. 29:15)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Parents of young children often grow weary of

disciplining them. They feel that all they do is

nag, scold, and punish. When you’re tempted to

give up and let your children do what they want,

or when you wonder if you’ve ruined every

chance for a loving relationship with them,

remember that kind, firm correction helps

them learn, and learning makes them wise

Consistent, loving discipline will ultimately

teach them to discipline themselves.

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord help me see clearly when our *

*children need my advice. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
Parents of young children often grow weary of disciplining them. They feel that all they do is
nag, scold, and punish. When you’re tempted to give up and let your children do what they want, or when you wonder if you’ve ruined every chance for a loving relationship with them, remember that kind, firm correction helps them learn, and learning makes them wise Consistent, loving discipline will ultimately teach them to discipline themselves.
original_subject: THE NEED TO CORRECT OUR CHILDREN
original_verse_text: To discipline and reprimand a child produces wisdom, but a mother is disgraced by an undisciplined child.
prayer: Dear Lord help me see clearly when our children need my advice. Amen.
reflection:
Parents of young children often grow weary of disciplining them. They feel that all they do is
nag, scold, and punish. When you’re tempted to give up and let your children do what they want, or when you wonder if you’ve ruined every chance for a loving relationship with them, remember that kind, firm correction helps them learn, and learning makes them wise Consistent, loving discipline will ultimately teach them to discipline themselves.
subject: The Need to Correct Our Children
verse_text: To discipline and reprimand a child produces wisdom, but a mother is disgraced by an undisciplined child.

original_content:
message_id: 17c7be3a8699d177
subject   : Subject: FOLLOWING DIVINE GUIDANCE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 13 Oct 2021 18:01:30 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*When people do not accept divine guidance,*

* they run wild. But whoever obeys the law is*

* happy. *(Pro. 29:18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

”Divine guidance” refers to words from God

received by prophets. Where there is ignorance

of God, crime and sin run rampant. Public mor-

ality depends on the knowledge of God, but it

*also* depends on keeping God’s Laws. In order

for nations and individuals to function well,

people must know God’s ways and keep His rules.

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, it goes without saying I *

*need Your Holy Spirit’s divine guidance each *

*and every day. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
”Divine guidance” refers to words from God received by prophets. Where there is ignorance
of God, crime and sin run rampant. Public mor- ality depends on the knowledge of God, but it also depends on keeping God’s Laws. In order for nations and individuals to function well, people must know God’s ways and keep His rules.
original_verse_text: When people do not accept divine guidance, they run wild. But whoever obeys the law is happy.

of God, crime and sin run rampant. Public mor- ality depends on the knowledge of God, but it also depends on keeping God’s Laws. In order for nations and individuals to function well, people must know God’s ways and keep His rules.
subject: Following Divine Guidance
verse_text: When people do not accept divine guidance, they run wild. But whoever obeys the law is happy.

original_content:
message_id: 17c866a511fe1a9a
subject   : Subject: PLACING OUR TRUST IN HIS LOVE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 15 Oct 2021 19:04:47 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Fearing people is a dangerous trap, but to trust*

* the Lord means safety. **(Pro. 29:25)*



*Today’s Reflection: *

Fear of people can hamper everything you try to

do. In extreme forms, it can make you afraid to

leave your home. By contrast, fear of God—res-

pect, reverence, and trust—is liberating. Why

fear people who can do no eternal harm? Instead,

trust God who can turn the harm intended by

others to good for those who trust God.

* Pastor Sather*

*I thank You Lord for guiding me even when I *

*am less then deserving of Your grace. **Amen. *
original_reflection_text:
Fear of people can hamper everything you try to
do.
In extreme forms, it can make you afraid to
leave your home. By contrast, fear of God—res-
pect, reverence, and trust—is liberating. Why
fear people who can do no eternal harm? Instead, trust God who can turn the harm intended by
others to good for those who trust God.

do.
In extreme forms, it can make you afraid to
leave your home. By contrast, fear of God—res-
pect, reverence, and trust—is liberating. Why
fear people who can do no eternal harm? Instead, trust God who can turn the harm intended by
others to good for those who trust God.
subject: Placing Our Trust in His Love
verse_text:
Fearing people is a dangerous trap, but to trust
 the Lord means safety.

original_content:
message_id: 17c8b6b6ae7fbd31
subject   : Subject: BE SURE WHAT YOU ASK FOR IS TO GOD'S LIKING
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 16 Oct 2021 18:24:05 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*O God, I beg two favors from You before*

* I die. First, help me to never tell a lie. *

*Second, give me neither poverty nor riches! *

*Give me just enough to satisfy **my needs.*

(Pro. 30:7-8)


*Today’s Reflection:*

Having to much can be dangerous, *but* so can

having too little. Being poor can, in fact, be ha-

zardous to spiritual as well physical health. On

the other hand, being rich is not the answer. As

Jesus pointed out, rich people have trouble get-

ting into God’s kingdom (Mt. 19:23,24). Like

Paul, we can learn how to live whether we have

little or a lot (Phil. 4:12), but our lives are more

likely to be effective if we have neither poverty

or riches.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, my prayer is like that of the writer of *

*these two verses. I ask two favors of You before I *

*die. First, help me to never tell a lie. Second, give *

*me neither poverty nor riches! Give me just enough *

*to satisfy my needs. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
Having to much can be dangerous, but so can having too
little. Being poor can, in fact, be hazardous to spiritual
as well physical health. On the other hand, being rich is
not the answer. As Jesus pointed out, rich people have
trouble getting into God’s kingdom (Matthew 19:23,24). Like
Paul, we can learn how to live whether we have little or a
lot (Philippians 4:12), but our lives are more likely to be
effective if we have neither poverty or riches.
original_subject: BE SURE WHAT YOU ASK FOR IS TO GOD'S LIKING

God, I beg two favors from You before I die. First, help me
to never tell a lie. Second, give me neither poverty nor
riches! Give me just enough to satisfy my needs.
prayer:
Dear Lord, my prayer is like that of the writer of these two
verses. I ask two favors of You before I die. First, help me
to never tell a lie. Second, give me neither poverty nor
riches! Give me just enough to satisfy my needs. Amen.
reflection:
Having to much can be dangerous, but so can having too
little. Being poor can, in fact, be hazardous to spiritual
as well physical health. On the other hand, being rich is
not the answer. As Jesus pointed out, rich people have
trouble getting into God’s kingdom (Matthew 19:23,24). Like
Paul, we can learn how to live whether we have little or a
lot (Philippians 4:12), but our lives are more likely to be
effective if we have neither poverty or riches.

riches! Give me just enough to satisfy my needs.

original_content:
message_id: 17c9013bdb2cc87e
subject   : Subject: A CORRECTION OF TRUE WOMANHOOD
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 17 Oct 2021 16:06:25 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Charm is deceptive, and beauty does not last, but a woman *

*who fears the Lord will be greatly praised. Reward her for *

*what she has done. Let her deeds publicly declare her praise. *

(Pro. 31:30-31)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The book of Proverbs begins with the command to fear the

Lord (1:7) and ends with the picture of a woman who fills

this command. Her qualities are mentioned throughout the

book: hard work, fear of God, respect for spouse, foresight,

encouragement, care for other, concern for the poor, wisdom

in handling money. These qualities, when coupled with coup-

led with the fear of God lead to enjoyment, success, honor

and worth. Proverbs is practical for us because it shows how

to become wise, make good decisions, and live according to

God’s ideal.

*Pastor Sather*

*I thank You for what I have learned by going through the *

*book of Proverbs. Help me to live according to the guidance *

*that has been pre**sented in this book. **Amen.*

coupled with the fear of God lead to enjoyment, success,
honor and worth. Proverbs is practical for us because it
shows how to become wise, make good decisions, and live
according to God’s ideal.

what she has done. Let her deeds publicly declare her
praise.

book of Proverbs. Help me to live according to the guidance
that has been presented in this book. Amen.

original_content:
message_id: 17c956b4b9485b8d
subject   : Subject: THREE VOICES
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 18 Oct 2021 17:00:09 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*“Look at the proud! They trust in themselves, and their lives *

*are crooked; but the righteous will live by faith. *(Hab. 2:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

If we listen carefully to those around us, we will learn to

distinguish three voices, or influences, which direct the thinking

and attitudes and actions of us all. We can hear them at our work,

in our homes, and in the quietness of our moments alone.

*Fear *(is the first voice) it disguises itself as “being safe,” as

“practical,” or “reasonable.” We need to look for the motive

behind the disguise.

*Fantasy *(is the second voice) disguises itself as “visionary,” as

“progressive,” “imaginative,” or creative.” Look for the motive

behind the disguise.

*Faith *is the third voice. *Faith* reminds us that this is God’s world,

that He is always with us, that He works with us and in spite of us

and that He will complete the wonderful work He began in spite

of what it may look like to us today! All three voices will speak to

you today. BUT only *faith* offers life. May we govern our personal
decisions and our decisions on behalf of the church through the voice

of *faith.*

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always distinguish the correct *

*voice to follow, the voice of faith. **Amen. *
original_reflection_text:
If we listen carefully to those around us, we will learn to distinguish three voices, or influences, which direct the thinking and attitudes and actions of us all. We can hear them at our work, in our homes, and in the quietness of our moments alone.
Fear (is the first voice) it disguises itself as “being safe,” as “practical,” or “reasonable.” We need to look for the motive behind the disguise. Fantasy (is the second voice) disguises itself as “visionary,” as “progressive,” “imaginative,” or creative.” Look for the motive behind the disguise.
Faith is the third voice. Faith reminds us that this is God’s world, that He is always with us, that He works with us and in spite of us and that He will complete the wonderful work He began in spite of what it may look like to us today! All three voices will speak to you today. BUT only faith offers life. May we govern our personal decisions and our decisions on behalf of the church through the voice of faith.

prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always distinguish the correct voice to follow, the voice of faith. Amen.
reflection:
If we listen carefully to those around us, we will learn to distinguish three voices, or influences, which direct the thinking and attitudes and actions of us all. We can hear them at our work, in our homes, and in the quietness of our moments alone.
Fear (is the first voice) it disguises itself as “being safe,” as “practical,” or “reasonable.” We need to look for the motive behind the disguise. Fantasy (is the second voice) disguises itself as “visionary,” as “progressive,” “imaginative,” or creative.” Look for the motive behind the disguise.
Faith is the third voice. Faith reminds us that this is God’s world, that He is always with us, that He works with us and in spite of us and that He will complete the wonderful work He began in spite of what it may look like to us today! All three voices will speak to you today. BUT only faith offers life. May we govern our personal decisions and our decisions on behalf of the church through the voice of faith.

original_content:
message_id: 17c9a6240856a934
subject   : Subject: THE CREATOR OF ALL
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 19 Oct 2021 16:08:23 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Have you never heard or understood? Don’t you know*

* that the Lord is the everlasting God, the Creator of all*

* the earth? He never grows faint or tired? No one can *

*measure the depths of His understanding. *(Isa. 40:28)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We did not come this far—nor to this place—alone,

but in the presence and power of our God. The circum-

stances of this moment are not greater than our God.

He knows them better than we do, yet He permits them.

And He will overcome them—within us if we will

allow Him. Ours is not to fret as though He does not

know, or care, or cannot overcome. Ours is to walk on

knowing that He is here. We are His by His creation,

and His by new birth. We are His to do with as He chooses—

to bless or to use up, to serve or to simply endure. The day

belongs to our Lord, and it is the only day we have to

serve and glorify Him. And so *I shall *give all that *I have* and

*am t*hat for this one day He shall be honored.

*Pastor Sather*

*I pray that I will continue to honor and glorify You*

* for the rest of my days**. *Amen.
original_reflection_text: We did not come this far—nor to this place—alone, but in the presence and power of our God. The circumstances of this moment are not greater than our God. He knows them better than we do, yet He permits them. And He will overcome them—within us if we will allow Him. Ours is not to fret as though He does not know, or care, or cannot overcome. Ours is to walk on knowing that He is here. We are His by His creation, and His by new birth. We are His to do with as He chooses— to bless or to use up, to serve or to simply endure.The day belongs to our Lord, and it is the only day we have to serve and glorify Him. And so I shall give all that I have and am that for this one day He shall be honored.
original_verse_text: Have you never heard or understood? Don’t you know that the Lord is the everlasting God, the Creator of all the earth? He never grows faint or tired? No one can  measure the depths of His understanding.
prayer: I pray that I will continue to honor and glorify You for the rest of my days. Amen.
reflection: We did not come this far—nor to this place—alone, but in the presence and power of our God. The circumstances of this moment are not greater than our God. He knows them better than we do, yet He permits them. And He will overcome them—within us if we will allow Him. Ours is not to fret as though He does not know, or care, or cannot overcome. Ours is to walk on knowing that He is here. We are His by His creation, and His by new birth. We are His to do with as He chooses— to bless or to use up, to serve or to simply endure.The day belongs to our Lord, and it is the only day we have to serve and glorify Him. And so I shall give all that I have and am that for this one day He shall be honored.

verse_text: Have you never heard or understood? Don’t you know that the Lord is the everlasting God, the Creator of all the earth? He never grows faint or tired? No one can  measure the depths of His understanding.

original_content:
message_id: 17ca9e4075164fe7
subject   : Subject: CAN YOU FIND 16 BOOKS OF THE BIBLE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 22 Oct 2021 16:24:26 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
I once made a remark about the hidden books of the Bible. It was a
lulu. Kept people looking so hard for the facts and for others it was a
revelation. Some were in a jam, especially since the names of the books
were not capitalized, but the truth finally struck home to numbers of
readers. To others it was not a real job. We want it to be a most
fascinating few moments for you. Yes, there will be some real easy ones to
spot. Others may require judges to help them. I will quickly admit it
usually takes a minister to find one of them, and there will be a loud
lamentations when it is found. A little lady says she brews a cup of tea so
she can concentrate better. See how well you can compete. Relax now for
there really are sixteen names of books in the Bible in this story.

*Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:

original_subject: CAN YOU FIND 16 BOOKS OF THE BIBLE
original_verse_text: "Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path."
prayer:
Lord God,
Thank You for the joy of Your Word and the way it hides truth in plain sight. As we read and reflect, open our eyes to see what we often overlook and our hearts to receive what You reveal. Give us patience to search, wisdom to understand, and delight in every discovery—whether simple or subtle. Let Your Scriptures guide us, comfort us, and unite us in wonder. Help us to cherish not only the names of the books but the Living Word to which they point, Jesus Christ our Lord.
Amen. (AI)

verse_text: "Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path."
